[Intro]
[ch]A[/ch]    [ch]F#m[/ch]   [ch]D[/ch]  [ch]E[/ch]  [ch]A[/ch]

[Verse 1]

When the night has come
[ch]F#m[/ch]
  And the land is dark
         [ch]D[/ch]           [ch]E[/ch]                 [ch]A[/ch]
And the moon is the only light we'll see
        [ch]A[/ch]
No, I won't be afraid,
      [ch]F#m[/ch]
No, I won't be afraid
         [ch]D[/ch]            [ch]E[/ch]             [ch]A[/ch]
Just as long as you stand, stand by me.

[Chorus]
[ch]E[/ch]    [ch]F#m[/ch] [ch]E[/ch]    [ch]A[/ch] [ch]G#m[/ch]     [ch]A[/ch]
So, darling, darling, stand by me,
    [ch]F#m[/ch]
Oh, stand by me.
    [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]E[/ch]    [ch]A[/ch]
Oh, stand, stand by me,
Stand by me.

[Verse 2]
         [ch]A[/ch]
If the sky that we look upon
[ch]F#m[/ch]
Should tumble and fall
            [ch]D[/ch]         [ch]E[/ch]                 [ch]A[/ch]
Or the mountain should crumble in the sea,
          [ch]A[/ch]
I won't cry, I won't cry,
      [ch]F#m[/ch]
No, I won't shed a tear
            [ch]D[/ch]            [ch]E[/ch]             [ch]A[/ch]
Just as long as you stand, stand by me.

[Chorus]
[ch]E[/ch]    [ch]F#m[/ch] [ch]E[/ch]    [ch]A[/ch] [ch]G#m[/ch]     [ch]A[/ch]
And darling, darling, stand by me,
    [ch]F#m[/ch]
Oh, stand by me.
     [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]E[/ch]            [ch]A[/ch]
Oh, stand now, stand by me,
Stand by me.

[Instrumental]
[ch]A[/ch]    [ch]F#m[/ch]   [ch]D[/ch]  [ch]E[/ch]  [ch]A[/ch]    x2

[Chorus]
[ch]E[/ch]    [ch]F#m[/ch] [ch]E[/ch]    [ch]A[/ch] [ch]G#m[/ch]     [ch]A[/ch]
So, darling, darling, stand by me,
    [ch]F#m[/ch]
Oh, stand by me.
     [ch]D[/ch]               [ch]E[/ch]
Oh, stand now, stand by me,
      [ch]A[/ch]
Stand by me.

[Outro]

Whenever you're in trouble won't you stand by me, oh, stand by me
     [ch]D[/ch]              [ch]E[/ch]             [ch]A[/ch]
Oh, stand now, oh, stand, stand by me

content.text:
Stand By Me - words and music by Ben E. King, Jerry Leiber and Mike Stoller
    
     Note: I have taken this from the original score and matched it to the 1961 recording 
               https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hwZNL7QVJjE
           This was originally written in C with the G7 as a lead-in chord. 
           The singer is singing     E    G   A
                                   "When the night" 
               which I think has confused some the people's different versions here.
           This is a simple 4 chord song that is all about the singers timing so I included.

[Intro]

[ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Am[/ch]   [ch]F[/ch]   [ch]G7[/ch]


[Verse 1]

[ch]G7[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]                       [ch]Am[/ch]                         
When the night        has come      and the land is da-rk
        [ch]F[/ch]               [ch]G7[/ch]                     [ch]C[/ch]   
And the mo-on    is the on- ly     light we'll see 
   
     [ch]C[/ch]                [ch]C[/ch]               [ch]Am[/ch]             
No I wo-n't     be af-raid, no     I  won't  be af-raid           
        [ch]F[/ch]              [ch]G7[/ch]                   [ch]C[/ch]              
Just as long    as you st-and,     stand by me.      So darl-lin', darl-lin'


[Chorus 1]

[ch]C[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]                [ch]Am[/ch]                                      
stand   by    me,       oh--h  sta- and  by   me,      
     [ch]F[/ch]        [ch]G7[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]          
Ohh, stand      Stand by me,   stand by meee.            


[Verse 2]

       [ch]C[/ch]                          [ch]Am[/ch]                        
If the sky   that we look up-on      should tumble and fall
       [ch]F[/ch]                    [ch]G7[/ch]                  [ch]C[/ch]     
Or the mount-ain     should crum-mble   to the  sea 
                     
        [ch]C[/ch]                                [ch]Am[/ch]               
I won't cry,    I won't cry, no--oo-   I won't   shed a tear
        [ch]F[/ch]               [ch]G7[/ch]                  [ch]C[/ch]        
Just as long     as you st-and,    stand by me.     And   darl-ling, darl-ling


[Chorus 2]

[ch]C[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]                [ch]Am[/ch]         
stand   by    me,       oh--h  sta- and  by   me,      
     [ch]F[/ch]        [ch]G7[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]          
Ohh, stand      Stand by me,   stand by meee.            
              

[Solo]

[ch]C[/ch]                [ch]Am[/ch]             [ch]F[/ch]        [ch]G7[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]

[ch]C[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]                [ch]Am[/ch]

Ohh, stand      Stand by me,   stand by me. Whenever! you're in trouble just

stand   by    me,       oh--h  sta- and  by   me,      
      [ch]F[/ch]        [ch]G7[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]          
Woow, stand      Stand by me,   stand by meee. (fade)

Album: Sheer Heart Attack (1974)
Provided By Ben Brown
Capo 3 for Original

Just a simpler version of the song for quick and easy learning, 
or for beginners who can't play the regular version. Some chords were
omitted from the song, others were simplified.  Enjoy!

I couldn't get on with the original chords starting in C but found this
version in an easy piano chords book. This is not a perfect version by any
means but it translates quite well to guitar. I've typed out some
instructions as I've experienced how frustrating it is to fathom out how
best to play the chords for this song if you're not a particularly
experienced guitarist.

Capo 3rd Fret

Verse One:

Start in A (002220), bar the 2nd fret for the Bm7 (224232), up 2 frets for
the C#m7 (446454), then up one fret for the Dmaj7 (557675) which allows you
to run straight back down the C#m7 then Bm7. The second line is easy open
chords with A (002220), Em7 (020000) to A7 (002020) then Dmaj7 (x00222)
followed by the G9 (300003). The third line is A (002220) then G9 (300003)
then bar the 2nd fret for the F#m7 (242222) then bar the 6th fret for the
Ebm7 (668676) straight down one fret to the D7 (557575) then start the last
line- down one fret to the C#maj7 (446564) then up one fret for the Dm7
(557565) then back to open chords for the G9 (300003) and Cmaj7 (332000)
then finally bar the 2nd fret for the Bm7 (224232) and down one fret for the
[ch]Bbmaj7[/ch] (113231).

Verse Two:

The first three lines are the same as verse one however the last line is
different. So after the D7 (557575) at the end of the 3rd line you start the
rundown barring the 4th fret for C#m7 (446454) down one fret to Cmaj7
(335453) then down another fret to Bm7 (224232) then one more fret to Bbmaj7
(113231) and finally ending on the standard A chord (002220).

Bridge:

The line starts on the A chord as ending on the 2nd verse then a standard
Em7 (020000) then A7 (002020) and then Dmaj7 (x00222) staying on this chord
for the start of the second line before going back to the Em7 (020000) then
A7 (002020) then Dmaj7 (x00222). Stay on this chord for the start of
the third line before going to Dm7 (x00211) then G7 (320001) and then Cmaj7
(332000) then the last line is a B7 (x21202) and E7 (020100).

Verse Three:

The first three lines are the same as verse one however the last line is
different. So after the D7 (557575) at the end of the 3rd line you start the
rundown barring the 4th fret for C#m7 (446454) down one fret to Cmaj7
(335453) then down another fret to Bm7 (224232) then an open E7 (020100) and
finally ending on the standard A chord (002220).

Hey guys,

Just a little chord tab of how I play Use Somebody by The Kings of Leon on
acoustic. The Em DOES work and a few of the suggested replacements really don't sound right at all.
I also didn't tab the bridge because I don't think it flows well on acoustic as it goes straight into the solo
on the original version. Capo on 1st fret optional. All chords are the standard chords.


Chords used:

[ch]C[/ch] [ch]Em[/ch] [ch]F[/ch] [ch]Am[/ch]   (yes its that simple)

I hope you can understand it how i play it. if your un sure about the bit with
letting the F's ring, or you think its wrong let me know and i'll try explain it
better. Other than that, i hope you guys have a really awesome time playing a
really awesome song!
 Please rate and comment what you thought, as this is my first tab. Feedback MUCH 
:)

-----Edit-----

When playing the F chord in the verses try and let your finger catch the high E string 
you got for an up strum :) just adds a little something extra in there.
